intro: Platea kachinensis, commonly known as the Kachin platea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
